overview: In 1953, a young photographer named Victor Obsatz created a double-exposed portrait of Marcel Duchamp by mistake. 55 years later that photo appeared in the pages of Smithsonian Magazine and was featured at a Duchamp retrospective. Deux Champs (Two Fields) is a hand-processed reflection on the distant memory of that day and everything that has happened since.
title: Deux Champs (Two Fields)
